Tiramisu
(8 servings = 1 big pyrex dish)
6 egg whites
6 egg yolks
180g Sugar
750g Mascarpone
4 tbsp Grand Marnier
350g Savoiardi Biscuits
270ml strong coffee
Unsweetened cocoa powder
  1. Make the coffee and cool it completely
  2. Get 2 bowls
  3. Beat the egg whites until stiff in one
  4. Beat the egg yolks and sugar in the other until pale
  5. Beat the marsala (or other alcohol) into the egg yolks, followed by the mascarpone
  6. Fold in the egg whites
  7. Dunk the biscuits quickly in the coffee. If you have coffee left over, dunk them again
  8. Layer up: thin layer cream, biscuit, medium layer of cream, biscuit, thick layer of cream
  9. Chill until ready to serve, and then top with cocoa powder
Notes
  • One third recipe for small blue dish
  • Mascarpone is prone to curdling, so it should be whipped gently and as little as possible. It is said to be more likely to curdle if it's warm or different in temperature to other things added to it, so maybe best if everything is straight from the fridge. One advice is to leave it out 15 mins before using. Common advice to salvage curdled mascarpone is to put it into a double boiler for a couple fo minutes until smooth, then cool and rewhip
Variations
  • Recipe uses Grand Marnier but Marsala, Brandy, Amaretto or Kahlua would also be options
